title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
Hi,

I have an A1534 820-00045 that has no power. The ampmeter stays black, and I have no PPVBUS_E85 nither PPDCIN_E85_SS voltages. Nither seams to be shorted (0.555 on diode reading).

F4700 seams to be ok.

Already tried a known good DCIN cable, with same result.

Can you help?

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
Start checking diode mode to ground on CC1/2 lines.
Also compare the value at 3V0_AON with good board.

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
Diode readings:

E85_CC1 = 0.554
E85_CC2 = 0.014

I don't have a good board of this model, but it seams that CC2 is shorted. Shall i inject voltage on it, or replace U4700??

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
Is not pure short, to heat something there.
Replace the chip, is classic issue.

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message: I've replace U4700, and the short on CC2 has gone (0.555 on diode reading). However, I have the same behavier.

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
Post diode mode to ground at 3V0_AON.
May need to change U4780 and/or U4701 too.

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message: Diode on  3V0_AON = 0.333

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
Looks too low.
Change U4780 first.

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
I've replaced  U4780 and  U4701, but same behavier. Diode on  3V0_AON  is 0.329.
I notice now that C4750 PPDCIN_E85_SS seams to be a bit oxidized and corroded. It wasen't shorted, but i removed.  Can it be related?

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message: Diode mode on 3V0_AON should be higher than 0.400.

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
Replaced again U4700 but same thing. 
There are a lot of components with  3V0_AON. Shal I inject some voltage to figure out if something gets hotter?

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
Voltage injection cannot help here.

CD3215 chip used is good for sure?
Check diode mode to ground on its LDOs.

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message: Sorry, for the stupid question, but what CD3125? I can't find it on this board

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
Sorry for error; there was another thread with 00244 board.

You may have problem with U7000 in this case.

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message: Sorry, but I can't find it also. I replaced U7100, but same result. No power

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
U7100, is true.
What is actual diode mode to ground for 3V_AON?

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message: Diode on  PP3VR3V0_AON  = 0.324

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
Still low value.
Some chip must be affected there.
Try another U4700.

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
Replaced other U4700 but same result. 
PP3VR3V0_AON  = 0.328

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
You don't get any voltage at F4700?
What voltage do you get at CC1/2 lines?
Did you try another charger?

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
Hi,
I didn't read CC1/2 voltages, but I get 0V at F4700, and have tried 2 different chargers and cable connectors.

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
E85_CC1= 0V
E85_CC2 = 0.166V

Do you think that can be something shorted on a J4700 line? Do you have the resistance to ground of those pins on J4700?

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
Revert cable connection and check again.
CC1/2 lines change their function.

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message:
Hi,
With reverse conection, I get reverse values:

CC1 = 0.186V
CC2 = 0V

title: A1534 820-00045 no power
message: You need to compare readings with known good board...
